alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:05PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Thunderstorms sweeping west through the Blackfoot Reservoir region through 400 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms extending from 6 miles southeast of Henry to 7 miles north of Soda Springs, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Brief moderate rain, small hail, wind gusts to 30 mph, and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects as well as create hazardous boating conditions on Blackfoot Reservoir. Locations impacted include... Soda Springs, Blackfoot Reservoir, Chesterfield Reservoir, Henry, Chesterfield, Mill Canyon Campground and Bancroft. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near the Blackfoot Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
